ResearchProjectDef.label: Carbon Production
ResearchProjectDef.description: Carbon is an abundant and mouldable material with countless applications, a precursor for many spacer materials.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Carbon Nanotube Production
ResearchProjectDef.description: Microscopic tubes of carbon strung into a mesh makes for an extremely lightweight and durable material.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Carbon Fiber Production
ResearchProjectDef.description: Weaving carbon into cloth and leathers provides incredible reinforcement and protection.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Advanced Carbon Fiber Production
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn how interweave carbon fiber with Kevlar to produce a defensive fabric.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Carbon Fiber Lamination
ResearchProjectDef.description: Bonding carbon fiber with plastic materials creates a strong and light structural material.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Diamond Synthesis
ResearchProjectDef.description: Industrial diamonds can be synthesized from carbon fiber using heat and incredible pressure. This results in one of the strongest materials in nature.
